content:
During the last docs meeting, we discussed having a look around at Hugo themes individually before the next time we discuss the homepage. I won't be able to join February 21st, but here is a list of what I found as options to explore look-and-feel wise that I thought could be promising:

  • https://themes.gohugo.io/themes/docsy/ (demo: https://example.docsy.dev/): though meant for documentation, the homepage has a nice look and feel to it in line with earlier mock-ups.
  • https://themes.gohugo.io/themes/tailbliss/ (demo: https://tailbliss.netlify.app/prose/): Simple, but clean and modern look
  • https://themes.gohugo.io/themes/roxo-hugo/ (demo: https://roxo-hugo.staticmania.com/portfolio): Also looks promising. Sub pages are very image-heavy compared to tailbliss.
  • https://themes.gohugo.io/themes/devfest-theme-hugo/ (demo: https://2019.devfesttoulouse.fr/): I think itâ€™s meant for conferences/events, but also looks promising layout and style-wise. The map also looks nice.
thanks for the investigation, looking forward to reviewing these at the meeting next month! :big_smile:
